title: Sarah Betteley
subtitle: 8 down, 100 to go! Not a bad start to #milesforrefugees - this month I’ll be running 108 miles - the distance from Calais to London to raise money for British Red Cross projects supporting refugees. If you’d like to sponsor me you can here! - https://milesforrefugees19.everydayhero.com/uk/sarah-16 pic.twitter.com/077x1akN3L

title: Moulid Hujale
subtitle:
I'm honoured to be awarded "The Refugee Advocate of the Year" in the @somaliglamour’ Special Category 2019' 
I dedicate this Award to the 70 million people displaced globally. It's not just for their struggles but their survival and successes. #SomaliSuccess 
Thank you #SGA2019pic.twitter.com/Bj7qG4GEOx

title: (((Pobble)))
subtitle:
The Orinoco. 1939. 
Hamburg. Jewish refugees with visas for Mexico. Mexico said no to those who didn’t have the money to get to Mexico City. Orinoco sails to Cuba. Cuba says no. 
France: no. Britain: no. US says no but we’ve intervened; go back to Germany. 

200 die in Shoah. pic.twitter.com/hNaMptNsAM

title: Richard Williams
subtitle: A delivery driver has just asked about the refugees welcome poster in the window. Smiling, he said, “they didn’t have that 24 years ago”.   Originally from Sri Lanka, he applied for British citizenship last week. “Fingers crossed”, he said. Fingers crossed . #cityofsanctuarypic.twitter.com/ByiGPH6ZtB
